website_summaries.verdict: An option for those with devices that feature USB-C ports. Small without being easy to lose.
pros: A simple, compact model that is designed to be carried on a keychain
The USB-C design can help to free up a USB port
Works well with Windows,  Mac, and Android devices

customer_reviews.title: The Yubikey is not as widely supported as advertising would suggest.
customer_reviews.text: Yubikey provides their own own 6-digit-code 2FA app, which requires Yubikey to unlock, so they will advertise that any website that works with standard 6 digit code apps as supporting yubikey. Even the sites that do work with Yubikey will often only work with Google Chrome, despite Firefox supporting it and there being plugins to add support for Safari. I am returning my Yubikey but might buy one in the future if it gets better supported. I am disappointed in Yubico's dishonest marketing of their product.
customer_reviews.author: Ann

customer_reviews.title: Killed a Mac laptop
customer_reviews.text: I'm a tech-savvy person who's been working with and repairing computers for decades. After following the instructions to-the-letter (even copied and pasted terminal commands when appropriate), a 2016 MacBook Pro would not permit any logins. I had to "nuke & pave" the thing. NOT ready for prime-time.
customer_reviews.author: Taz Goldstein

customer_reviews.title: Say goodby to annoying text message confirmation codes
customer_reviews.text: If you're like me, you hate having to constantly check your texts and email to confirm that you are, in fact, you. This makes that oh so much easier. It sits on your keychain, and is as easy to use as just about anything I've ever purchased. Most password keepers (I use LastPass) have instructions for setting these up, so you don't even have to know what you're doing. I have tried to convince everyone that has ever asked about my yubi to buy one of their own -- they are phenomenal. Plus, if you ever bust one out in an interview at a tech company -- say hello to instant credibility.
customer_reviews.author: JHJH

customer_reviews.title: Has potential but...
customer_reviews.text: Useful, however, I have found I have tired of having to unplug and plug in the key to authenticate. I personally find it easier to use a phone authenticator app. If I could leave the device plugged in and it would work consistently then great but I have never been able to get it to consistently work with a number of web sites. Google authentication process on login is spotty in my experience I have to wiggle the key to have it work. I love the idea but the actual execution is a little off in my personal experience.
customer_reviews.author: Technophobe01

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. Just be aware that the rest of the world is still trying to catch up to this tech. The 5 series does not work with the Windows Hello app for logging in yet. They may add support later but it looks like they are going in a different direction from what I’ve seen online. You will also find that you need to use the Chrome browser for some sites as they do not support Edge or Firefox. It works great with Bitwarden password manager. Some of my accounts don’t yet support security keys but I figured I’d get ahead of the curve.
customer_reviews.author: Eugene Abel

customer_reviews.title: Simple device that just works
customer_reviews.text: Much faster than using a software based token generator, just plug it in and it works. Works as 2FA for Amazon AWS and for my companies corporate single sign on. I leave mine plugged in all the time. My only complaint is the touch sensor is on both the top and bottom, so it can be inadvertently pressed by ones leg when using the laptop on the couch. 99% of the time I’m working from a hard surface, so not a huge issue for me.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin B

customer_reviews.title: Blocks soft keyboard on Chrome OS
customer_reviews.text: Bought for Pixelbook, but found that it detects as hardware keyboard and blocks soft keyboard in tablet mode. It is not easy to remove. Otherwise performs as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Lowry

customer_reviews.title: I SHOULDN'T HAVE TO DO RESEARCH.  like the commercial, this is NO EASY chore.
customer_reviews.text: where's the instructions..ok plug n play? Ok.. oh nope its still not doing... What? Yea i looked at you tube videos. I learned that you love your company and the name of the product has a 5 in it... Something about a compatible app? What's all this, manual add crap? Won't it just do that one thing like the contacts to a new phone.. i hear copy paste is a thing... Im so confused after 3 hrs. Dumb it down more. I only use a phone... Is that the problem?
customer_reviews.author: Pan

customer_reviews.title: Simple, effective, hard to lose
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this guy after receiving a 5C Nano for Christmas and being quite pleased with the functionality, but feeling unsafe carrying such a small valuable device around with me. Now, I use the Nano as a backup and attach the "full-size" 5C to my keychain using the hole provided. It bangs around with my other keys without getting hurt, and I can plug it into and out of my laptop and phone without struggle. Great product overall.
customer_reviews.author: Neill

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic product
customer_reviews.text: I am an information security professional and CISO at multiple companies. I have used Yubikey products since they were first released and they are a fantastic product that is very well supported and backed by the manufacturer. I have bought nearly 100 of these low profile devices and use one myself every day in my MacBook Pro. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: AxlF

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Key
customer_reviews.text: Unlike the other keys which go on a keychain, this little guy slips right into your computer's USB-C port and the profile is even smaller than I anticipated. Button to push is on the side of the device. Seems like good build quality and will just live on my computer, like a sea lamprey. Software works reliably, just as much as any of the other Yubikey devices. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Hayden

customer_reviews.title: Tough as nails, works every time, versatile, discreet.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this on my Keychain for over a month and it is tough as nails and tiny. It doesn't bother me at all and I barely notice it's there but when I need it, it works. I chose this version because I wanted something I could use on my phone (USB C) without having to rely on radio frequencies that (as anyone looking into cyber security) is somewhat easy to hack. Also bu doing this I don't need to have my NFC active 24/7 and I save on battery. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: tortugaveloz

customer_reviews.title: 2FA EVERYTHING
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd Yubikey and I wish they were more affordable, I'd have a few more. You really can't discount how important 2 factor is today and these make for a nice alternative to the Authy/Google Authenticator dance. So far, they're working just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Brad H

customer_reviews.title: Cool gadget, easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: With today's digital security at risk, the Yubikey is a perfect product. Easy to use and setup. Perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Great product which could be perfect in the next revision. Two issues. First it could use a bevel on the inside edge to make it easier to remove. Second it caused my computer to keep the usbc port active the entire time it was inserted. This caused unnecessary battery drain on my laptop. If those two issues could be resolved this would be perfect.
customer_reviews.author: JadedJak

customer_reviews.title: Works great - if you are lucky and it gets setup.
customer_reviews.text: I’m a techie, but this device had me scratching my head - a lot. I got it working with Dropbox and Google, no luck on my MacBook Pro or any other software programs, though. It was very frustrating - documentation tries to lead you through setting things up but I think an updated video would be more effective - it was frustrating. Ever just stumble through setting something up and cross your fingers and it just works? That is how I would describe the setup of this item - only my success rate was only about 30% of the attempts to set up software or hardware to use this item. I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Glen F.

customer_reviews.title: It does a thing!
customer_reviews.text: I still don't really understand what that thing is, but it does it! I think this tech is still really young, so it's not easy to set up at all. Once you've got it set up, it's easy to use, but you've got to dig hard to get to where you need to be to do the configurations.
customer_reviews.author: Carl Forgey

customer_reviews.title: USB-C drive keys do NOT work..
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a YubiKey 5C for my macbook pro with USB-C. It would not plug into the USB-C drive. None of the 4 will take the YubiKey. Waste of time and Quality Control on the YubiCo brand is obviously subpar. Look elsewhere
customer_reviews.author: Daryl

customer_reviews.title: Came with no instructions and it some wierd type of key
customer_reviews.text: Came with no instructions and does not fit in a standard USB port
customer_reviews.author: Skip McGrath

customer_reviews.title: People are simply lazy that do not utilize this
customer_reviews.text: Nice product. Have been using for many years to most my rigs especially any laptops that will be left on-site, like the added security against someone cracking the machine
customer_reviews.author: M Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Small, unobtrusive but so convenient!
customer_reviews.text: I use this for logging into multiple accounts. It's very small, unobtrusive and super convenient! Once MFA is set up for the site, you just have to tap the top if it when you get the MFA prompt. Road warriors may want the bigger one to put it on a keychain or lanyard as this tiny one could be easily misplaced or lost. I put mine in a small travel pouch on my keychain, but it mostly just stays plugged in.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Frosch

customer_reviews.title: Must have for Android security
customer_reviews.text: Not just to lockdown you Google account, but it can store the key of those two step authentication generator off your device so it cant be fish out of it.
customer_reviews.author: Puss 'n' Boot LP

customer_reviews.title: Nice little key for MacBook, a bit expensive though
customer_reviews.text: I'm stuck at home due to the virus things and so I've plenty of time to make the yubikey more useful to me 1. gmail 2-steps 2. twitter 2-steps 3. passwordless login to my synology nas, couple raspberry pi and even hostgator account through ssh. This one is particularly useful as I no longer need to maintain a lots of private keys, it is just securely stored on the yubikey 4. keepassxc 5. gpg email A very useful little key. I just want to buy one more yubikey as backup but yubico no longer ship to Hong Kong. It is a shame. I'm a MacOS user by the way.
customer_reviews.author: Ray Chan

customer_reviews.title: Best hardware auth key
customer_reviews.text: Probably the best hardware auth key out there, albeit more geared towards desktop use due to the lacking NFC functionality. I did get it to work via USB-C on a Google Pixel 1, but not on my Oneplus 5. I'm therefore eagerly waiting for the Yubikey 5C NFC to come out.
customer_reviews.author: Moritz

customer_reviews.title: Someone should point out it is tiny!
customer_reviews.text: The picture is a bit deceptive. It’s very tiny. I love mine. Use it for everything I can use it for. More things should have this IMO. It’s super easy to use. The gold things are actually the buttons you push to activate it so thats something to keep in mind.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Works well, not highly supported
customer_reviews.text: There are many sites that listed in the "works with yubikey" that actually only work if you also use their app. AWS CLI is not supported. This does work well with Google accounts and password managers. Unless you have very high risk accounts, this probably isn't for you.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Convenience and peace of mind
customer_reviews.text: I've been using Yubikeys for years, so I was already a fan. I got this key because I have a new Macbook Pro that only has USB-C ports. Plus, I wanted the latest FIDO2 capabilities for passwordless authentication flows. The form factor is super tiny and doesn't seem to get in the way of anything. I use these on all my machines now.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Nice solution for passwordless
customer_reviews.text: It is really easy to use, there are some issues with macos that the token just write tokens everywhere. The biggest downside is it comes without a way to carry it around therefore you just leave it plugged in which loose the security
customer_reviews.author: Ori

customer_reviews.title: Thumbs up
customer_reviews.text: Must have for today’s environment. I also own Google titan
customer_reviews.author: Tom Khawaja

customer_reviews.title: small
customer_reviews.text: I like the small size. Can attach to keychain without bulk
customer_reviews.author: Deborah J King

customer_reviews.title: So far so good, works as expected
customer_reviews.text: Ever since I got a new Mac, I was missing my USB-A Yubikey Nano. While this Yubikey sticks out further than that nano did, it is much less prone to accidental bumps due to the design of how deep it sat in the USB slot. While this stick out a tiny bit, I don't notice it and it isn't in the way.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Bentley

customer_reviews.title: love yubikeybut the usb-c sesms to have issues
customer_reviews.text: I'm having issues with a static password on the 2nd memory location on both my keys. I'm having to press it five or six times to get it to take it without an error
customer_reviews.author: Nat

customer_reviews.title: Light. Great to have for usb C computers
customer_reviews.text: I like it so far. I worry the that connector might get damaged but its a great addition to my chromebook. It's light and plug and play straight out of the case.
customer_reviews.author: nessninja12

customer_reviews.title: Useful but not simple to configure
customer_reviews.text: Great product but not easy to install or configure. Plugged into MacBook easily but setup was painfu. Once configured it has been awesomel
customer_reviews.author: DesertKnight

customer_reviews.title: Best MFA device
customer_reviews.text: This is probably one of the best MFA authentication. Works just fine with mac and this tiny thing can just be plugged into the side and you won't even notice it's there. The best one so far . I will definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Sri

customer_reviews.title: YubiKey 5C Nano
customer_reviews.text: A great aid to the security of my computer! It works great with Lastpass and Bitwarden!
customer_reviews.author: T. Spencer

customer_reviews.title: Security is a must
customer_reviews.text: This USB-C YubiKey worked with a MacBook Pro without Touch ID, but it did not work with my Touch ID MacBook Air. Perhaps compatibility may come later? (one would need to check Yubico’s site)
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: Smaller...than I expected
customer_reviews.text: I no longer have to worry about protruding devices. This is perfect for laptops being heavily used for travel with multiple types of cases. Nice.
customer_reviews.author: Brad Mason

customer_reviews.title: great quality, easy to use and is worth the money
customer_reviews.text: great quality, easy to use and is worth the money
customer_reviews.author: Kalyan

customer_reviews.title: Security, Security, Security, but...
customer_reviews.text: I should have also bought it in NFC USB C if they had such.... I didn't check, and that's my fault.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Raymo

customer_reviews.title: It Just Works!
customer_reviews.text: The next step up for two-factor security . . . It just works.
customer_reviews.author: William W Davis Jr

customer_reviews.title: Ideal for MacBook and Duo
customer_reviews.text: Works perfect with MacBook Pro and Duo 2FA. No need to remove from port once inserted
customer_reviews.author: Bill O'

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Works great to implement a 2nd Factor for authentication and very simplistic but full of features that a Dev and other tool kits can find useful.
customer_reviews.author: Noah H.

customer_reviews.title: You Gotta Understand Computers A Bit!
customer_reviews.text: Great product if you are serious about your day to day use of computers and passwords. It really eases the burden of memorizing passwords.
customer_reviews.author: malbgc2014

customer_reviews.title: Works well with Linux
customer_reviews.text: The type-c model is really good as a rescue key. For some reason the USB DeviceID is similar to the 4C model.
customer_reviews.author: Roman Vercetti

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: The USB-C YubiKey is not reliable. My laptop is constantly making sounds that the key is removed, but it's still in place. When I touch it to authenticate, it doesn't work. I figured out that my fingers had to be a little moist for it to work. Don't buy this one.
customer_reviews.author: J. Molina

customer_reviews.title: Small form factor, easy to use, and convenient
customer_reviews.text: It was even smaller than I expected. Fits perfectly on my key ring. One click configuration met my expectations. I would recommend this to anyone interested in ditching SMS for multi factor authentication. She’s a beauty!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work with phones
customer_reviews.text: Tested with multiple USB-C phones, but it wouldn't work as intended. The key was detected as a keyboard, but none of the phones it was tested would work with it. Compared to the USB A Model, this key feels more sturdy, but the downside is no NFC.
customer_reviews.author: Henri Niemeläinen

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: High quality and worked perfectly on a pre-ordered cell phone and a 15 year laptop while using a C to A adapter.
customer_reviews.author: RK

customer_reviews.title: You will not regret.
customer_reviews.text: This works exactly as advertised and makes my life at work much easier. Amazing small form factor as well. No regrets on this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: William Vatcher

customer_reviews.title: Yubikey is the new way to 2FA!
customer_reviews.text: Much faster than 2-factor SMS and the Yubikey is always on my MacBook so no risk of ever losing it.
customer_reviews.author: Jose V

customer_reviews.title: Yubikey + LastPass + Chromebook = light & secure
customer_reviews.text: Great key; lives in my Chromebook. Works flawlessly with LastPass, Google, and more. Can sometimes be triggered accidentally depending on your laptop port configuration.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Vincent

customer_reviews.title: Best security device for a MacBook Pro
customer_reviews.text: Very strong fit with a minimal impact. With the Nano, I’m still able to use a simple sleeve to protect the notebook while keeping the security key in the plug long term. Works with providers such as Google and GitHub to secure account access, as well as work as a smart card provider that can be used for auth or GPG signing.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Wilcox

customer_reviews.title: Performs random, unwanted actions
customer_reviews.text: If you accidentally brush your hand against the dongle, it will cause all sorts of totally random, unwanted actions to happen in your desktop: windows will open and close, random areas will receive clicks, who knows what will happen to your work. It works as a key, but having your desktop go crazy every time you accidentally touch the thing is not worth it. I'm going to look for a different vendor that makes a product harder to activate accidentally. They really should have put the contacts on the sides instead of the top, where they would be harder to touch accidentally.
customer_reviews.author: Pria

customer_reviews.title: Simply get one
customer_reviews.text: Discreet, efficient and effective. I use it to log into my Macbook Pro as well as to push out Pre-registered passwords. As SmartCards go, I can't think of a better device to protect my data and device.
customer_reviews.author: LinuxProphet

customer_reviews.title: Great functionality
customer_reviews.text: Works as described, no issues. Slim form factor is a huge upgrade over the previous Non-USB C versions. Fits perfectly into a Macbook Pro. I wish there was a way to disable the LED lighting to be more discreet during low-light conditions (e.g. using on an airplane, etc).
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, fits perfectly on MacBook Pro
customer_reviews.text: Super easy setup on web sites. Fits perfectly on MBP. Soooo much easier than SMS codes.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Smith

customer_reviews.title: Triggers easily
customer_reviews.text: Works really well but sometimes I accidentally press it and it appears in my Instant Messanging and while I’m typing.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work on Chromebook
customer_reviews.text: Does not work on Chromebook. The best option is to use it on your Google Account. However, if you do that, you'll need it anytime you login and it still doesn't help with the login to the Chromebook.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Hlavac

customer_reviews.title: Worked well but then stopped responding after a few months. Disappointed in the quality.
customer_reviews.text: Worked well but then stopped responding after a few months. Disappointed in the quality.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas G

product_meta.title: Yubico YubiKey 5C - Two Factor Authentication USB Security Key, Fits USB-C Ports - Protect Your Online Accounts with More Than a Password, FIDO Certified USB Password Key
feature_bullets: SECURITY KEY: Protect your online accounts against unauthorized access by using 2 factor authentication with the Yubico YubiKey 5C security key. It's the world's most protective USB security key that works with more online services/apps than any other.

FIDO: The YubiKey 5C is FIDO certified and works with Google Chrome and any FIDO-compliant application on Windows, Mac OS or Linux. Secure your login and protect your Gmail, Facebook, Dropbox, Outlook, LastPass, Dashlane, 1Password, accounts and more.
FITS USB-C PORTS: Once registered, each service will request you to insert the YubiKey PC security key into a USB-C port and tap the gold contact to gain access.

DURABLE AND SECURE: Extremely secure and durable, YubiKeys are tamper resistant, water resistant, and crush resistant. The YubiKey 5C is designed to protect your online accounts from phishing and account takeovers. Proudly made in the USA.

MULTI-PROTOCOL SUPPORT: The YubiKey USB authenticator has multi-protocol support including FIDO2, FIDO U2F, Yubico OTP, OATH-TOTP, OATH-HOTP, Smart card (PIV), OpenPGP, and Challenge-Response capability to give you strong hardware-based authentication.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars457 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
